New Records: Mitchell Santner became the first New Zealand spinner to take a five-wicket haul at a Cricket World Cup
Key Match Events: New Zealand scored 322 for seven on a slow, dry wicket
Netherlands were bowled out for 223 in 46.3 overs
Mitchell Santner took five for 59 with his left-arm spin
Trent Boult took a spectacular boundary catch
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand avenged their narrow defeat in the 2019 World Cup final
Will Young and Devon Conway provided a solid stand of 67
Captain Kane Williamson's absence was not felt
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand's win boosted their morale ahead of the World Cup
Miscellaneous Highlights: Weather and pitch conditions affected the match
Netherlands had a tough time in their run chase
